comments: Dr. Hamilton is truly an inspiring women. Her knowledge on Native American literature is impressive and her passion shines through in her work. Do your reading and be prepared to discuss the material. She is very open to interpretation. I loved this course and would most definitely take one of her courses again.

Dr. Hamilton is very demanding but rightfully so -- she puts a lot of effort into her teaching and expects just as much back. She is a very strict, but reasonable grader. Don\'t try to BS your way through an essay or exam because she\'ll spot it a mile away. Awesome professor -- much learned -- I feel very disciplined and stronger.
Great teacher, good class. The poetry books were so dry I could not take it. Every day class was like like going to a book club. I would recommend her to anyone!
Amy seems like a nice person but the reading and discussion for this class was really boring. She also grades the final paper really harshly. I would strongly advise not taking this course.
Professor Hamilton is a great professor. Her assignments are kind of demanding, and she\'s a tough grader, but if you\'re interested in the subject you\'ll do good.

Professor Hamilton is a friendly and fair professor. I had a great deal of interest in the subject before I took the class but that interest expanded as the class progressed. She makes sure everyone participates and understands the work fully. A great professor!

This class was wonderful! Professor Hamilton chose really interesting texts and was usually pretty interesting and helpful. You could really tell she cared about the subject and about the students. I\'m not an English major, but I feel like I really got a lot out of this class.

The class wasn\'t super hard, she just made it harder and more confusing than it had to be! The entire class was structured around issues in higher education and that was extremely boring as all papers had something to do with that subject. BORING!
